author: fangjianwei
content: Hi I have a small question: I'm running a non-validating node, after The Merge, can I connecting to a public consensus client instead of running my own?

author: zhongfu
content: the CL client will need to interact with your EL client through the engine api (to feed it new execution payloads etc, i think), so i suspect no, not at the moment

author: m.kalinin
content: CL is driving the communication and is responsible for tracking the canonical chain. Allowing an external CL to drive your EL is insecure

author: yorickdowne
content: To add to what was said: Running a CL is lightweight compared to the EL. Once the EL enables the Engine API ... either with announced TTD or possibly earlier, watch Thursday's ACD for that discussion ... you can connect the CL to it. The CL can be checkpoint synced in seconds. You may see ELs ship with a light client CL embedded just for RPC/consensus purposes in future, but for now, any of the five CLs will do just fine and it isn't a ton of effort to set up.
